# List
A list is an N-object which can contain many different types of elements inside it like vectors, functions and even another list inside it.

```{r}
list1 = list(c(2,3,4), 21.3, sin, TRUE)
print(list1)

```

### Matrices
A matrix is a two-dimensional rectangular data set. It can be created using a vector input to the matrix function.

```{r}
M <- matrix(c('a', 'a', 'b', 'c', 'b', 'a'), nrow=2, ncol=3, byrow=TRUE)
print(M)
```
### Data Frame
data frame  are created using data.frame() function

```{r}
BMI <- data.frame(
  gender = c('Male', 'Male', 'Female'),
  height = c(178, 157, 164),
  weight = c(81, 80, 70),
  age = c(48, 46, 44)
)

print(BMI)
```

install.packages("tidyverse")
